page.title: 09Liverpool-Southport Railway
page.content: The busy{electric train}carrying commuters, shoppers and summer visitors stops at{Freshfield}on its way between Liverpool and Southport. Each train has three carriages and during the rush hours, 7.00am-9.30am and 4.00pm-6.00pm, they put on an extra three. On average 170 people travel on each carriage each day. The engines are 507's and 508's. In the winter a train puts down de-icer on the live rail, and in the summer weed- killer. The reason for the weedkiller is that the weeds have oil in them which causes the train to slide past the station. The biggest problem is summer vandalism, this being one of the reasons why there are no toilet facilities at{Freshfield station.}Five people work here. Merseyside Passenger Transport Executive organizes the trains.
